original: Johansson, Karl Herbert, lektor, Kalmar, f. 19i/10/91 i Vrå, Krono’b. 1., av August J. o. Maria Johansson. G. 28 m. Astrid Elvira Afors. — Stud:-ex. 13, teol. fil. ex. i Lund 14, teol. kand. 16, prakt. teol. prov samt prästv. 17, teol. lic. 35, teol. dr 38, provår 39. Res. t. Tyskl., Frankr. o. Ital. 24, Tyskl. 29, Tjeckoslov., Ungern, Jugoslav, o. Ital. 35. E. o. prästman 17-22, kommin. i Ny dal a 22, i Wallsjö 22-25, kyrkoh. i Lommaryd 25-40, lektor i kristend :kunsk. o. fil. v. Kalmar h. a. 1. sed. 40. Var i Lommaryd ordf. i kommrfullm. 28-40, ordf. i Jönköp. 1. sällsk. f. kristl. kär-leksverksamh. 38-45. Skr.: Sv. soc-kensjälvstyr. 1686—1862 (37), Kyrkobruk o. gudstjänstliv under 1700-talet (38) m. m.
translated: Johansson, Karl Herbert, lecturer, Kalmar, born on October 19, 1891 in Vrå, Kronoberg County, to parents August J. and Maria Johansson. Married Astrid Elvira Afors on June 28. Completed high school in 1913, received a degree in theology and philosophy from Lund University in 1914, became a candidate of theology in 1916, passed the practical theology exam and was ordained as a priest in 1917. Earned a licentiate degree in theology in 1935 and a doctorate in theology in 1938, and completed an internship in 1939. Traveled to Germany, France, and Italy in 1924 and to Germany in 1929, and traveled to Czechoslovakia, Hungary, Yugoslavia, and Italy in 1935. Served as a curate from 1917-1922, a curate in Nydal from 1922, a curate in Wallsjö from 1922-1925, a vicar in Lommaryd from 1925-1940, and a lecturer in Christian knowledge and philosophy at Kalmar high school from 1940. Served as chairman of the municipal council in Lommaryd from 1928-1940, and chairman of the Jönköping Society for Christian Charity Work from 1938-1945. Authored several works, including "Swedish Parish Self-Government 1686-1862" (1937) and "Church Practice and Worship Life during the 1700s" (1938).

structured.name: Karl Herbert Johansson

education.description: Completed high school in 1913, received a degree in theology and philosophy from Lund University in 1914, became a candidate of theology in 1916, passed the practical theology exam and was ordained as a priest in 1917. Earned a licentiate degree in theology in 1935 and a doctorate in theology in 1938.

structured.description: Swedish theologian and lecturer who served as a curate, vicar, and chairman of various organizations.
